editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Commentary on Matthew
msItem.rubric: Incipit prefacio sancti Hieronimi presbiteri super Mattheum
msItem.incipit: Liber generacionis...; In Ysaia legimus Generacionem eius quis enarrabit
msItem.explicit: non ignorat eam diem in qua se scit futurum cum apostolis
msItem.finalRubric: Finit liber quartus commentarii beati Hieronymi presbiteri super Matheum

msItem.author: Victorinus of Pettau
msItem.title: Commentary on the Apocalypse (Recensio breuior Hieronymi)
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus beatissimi Ieronimi ad Anatolium de explanacione apocalipsis
msItem.incipit: Diuersos maxima discrimina transcendentes inueniunt casus
Principium libri beatitudinem legenti audienti et seruanti promittit
msItem.note: CPL 80; CSEL 49 (1916), pp. 11–154; Stegmüller, Bibl. 3457; Lambert 490, 1.

msItem.title: De Monogramma Christi
msItem.incipit: Hec est sapiencia et intellectus id est sapere et intelligere
msItem.explicit: que pater possint in sua potestate
msItem.note: ed. G. Morin, Anecdota Maredsolana III (3) (Maredsous, 1903), pp. 195–8, repr. PL Suppl. 2. 287–91; Lambert 508. All of the other known copies of this work are Continental and from the ninth century, except for BL Harl. 3049, s. xv, from Durham.

msItem.author: Syagrius
msItem.title: Regulae definitionum contra haereticos prolatae
msItem.rubric: Regule diffinicionum sancti Ieronimi contra hereticos
msItem.incipit: Omne quod est aut ingenitum est aut genitum aut factum
msItem.note: CPL 560; ed. K. Künstle, Antipriscilliana (Freiburg, 1905), pp. 142–59; Lambert 506.

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome (Cummean)
msItem.title: Commentary on Mark
msItem.rubric: Incipit prefacio sancti Ieronimi presbiteri super Marcum
msItem.incipit: Omnis scriba doctus in regno celorum similis est homini patrifamilias
Initium euangelii Iesu Christi filii Dei sicut scriptum est in Ysaia
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit commentarium beati Hieronymi presbiteri super euangelium Marci

msItem.author: Pelagius
msItem.title: Commentaries on the Pauline Epistles
msItem.incipit: Primum queritur quare post euangelia que supplementum legis sunt
Romani sunt qui ex Iudeis gentibus
Paulus. Querimus quare Paulus scribat cum Saulus ante sit uocatus
msItem.explicit: ceterum maiora crimina et que puniuntur cese uictime non remittunt
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt annotationes super epistolam ad Hebreos
msItem.note: Rom.-Philemon. CPL 728, 759; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6355–67; Lambert 481–2; ed. A. Souter, Texts & Studies, 9. 1–2 (Cambridge, 1926), repr. PL Suppl. 1, pp. 1110–1374 (ending with Philemon). Ps.-PELAGIUS, In Hebraeos (‘In primis dicendum est cur apostolus in hac epistola non seruauerit morem suum … Multipharie …; Per multos inquit prophetas et diuerso modo maioribus’) CPL 1122a; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6368; ed. E. Riggenbach, Die älteste lateinischen Kommentare zum Hebräerbrief (Leipzig, 1907), pp. 206–212; Lambert 485 (not this copy). Apparently copied from Oxford, Balliol Coll. 157 (not listed by Lambert), made for William Gray, bishop of Ely, probably between 1447 and 1454 (A. Souter in Proc. British Acad. 7 [1915/16], 277; Mynors, Balliol, p. 141).

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Commentarii in IV Epistulas Paulinas (Galat., Ephes., Tit., Philemon.)

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Ieronimi super epistolam ad Galathas
msItem.incipit: Pauci admodum dies sunt quod epistolam Pauli ad Philemonem interpretatus
Paulus ...; Non superbe ut quidam putant ...

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus eiusdem super epistolam Pauli apostoli ad Ephesios
msItem.incipit: Si quicquam est O Paula et Eustochium
Paulus ...; Si prepositio misterium eius per quem res agitur ostendit

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus eiusdem super epistolam ad Titum
msItem.incipit: Paulus ...; In epistola ad Romanos ita orsus est Paulus seruus Christi
Qui uolunt inter epistolas Pauli eam recipere que ad Philemonem scribitur

msItem.note: Throughout are chapter-numbers in the margins and in the upper outer corners of each recto, and other annotation, s. xvi in., some in the hand of Fitzjames, some in the hand of his ex dono (see below).

supportDesc.extent:
223 leaves (v + 218) 390 255
260 160
The edges retrimmed, affecting marginalia of s. xvi in., and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: a bifolium, the first leaf the front pastedown, A4, 1–58, 66, 7–88, 96, 10–178, 186(+ 1 after 6), 19–258, 264, 27–88, B4, the last leaf the rear pastedown; catchwords; quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form. fols. i and 216 are of thick, stiff parchment.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with fine pencil in 2 cols of 51–3 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single Continental archaizing bookhand, also found also MS 25.

decoDesc.decoNote: English: fol. 1 has a full floral border and 8-line initial in colours and gold; at the bottom are the arms of Fitzjames of Dorset and Somerset, not an integral part of the border but painted over it. Art. 5 opens with an initial and 3-sided floral border in colours and gold. Arts 2, 3, 4, prols. and commentary on each book in arts 6 and 7, open with large champe initials. Blue initials flourished in red.

binding.p: s. xv ex.: brown polished leather over wide-bevelled wooden boards with slightly projecting squares, repaired; sewn on five bands, raised and outlined with string. Straps with clasps, now lost, from recesses in the front board to catches at the back, of which the lower remains. Nail-holes show that Fitzjames’ label, 160 × 70 mm., was once on the rear board. The marks of post-medieval chain-staples at the foredge of each board, near the foot at the front, near the head at the back.

history.provenance: On fol. vvis ‘In presenti uolumine continentur opera beati Hieronimi sequentia Ex dono domini Ricardi Fitzjames nuper Cicestrensis episcopi ac Custodis istius Collegii Cuius anime propicietur Deus amen ...’, in the usual untidy secretary hand. For Fitzjames see MS 9. On 31 Dec. 1498 and 14 Jan. 1499 he pledged it to the College in return for the loan of two separate copies of the Decretum, redeeming it on 29 Nov. (Registrum, pp. 227–8, 238).
On the front pastedown: ‘quere titulos folio 5’, s. xvii; ‘N. 2. 14. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with modern ‘B. 3. 4 (XXVI)’ in red. ‘14’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 20–1; Powicke, no. 1182; Alexander & Temple, no. 541.
